document.title: Florida Department of Education Adult General Education Curriculum Framework

F0FE43939CA04CA28B9F5450DE8D21D5.description:
Build a vocabulary of
terms and actions
frequently used by
computer-based testing;
such as, drag and drop,
drop-down, hot spot, short
answer, and extended
response.

AD424B6E13AE46AB9298D57C1A38FA81.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Acquire and use
accurately level-appropriate
general academic and domain-specific
words and
phrases; gather
vocabulary knowledge
when considering a
word or phrase
important to
comprehension or
expression.

582175072E274039952AF475B6EC0683.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Acquire and use
accurately level-appropriate
general  academic and domain-specific
words and
phrases, including
those that:-signal precise actions,
emotions, or states of
being (e.g., quizzed,
whined, stammered).-are basic to a
particular topic (e.g.,
wildlife, conservation,
and endangered
when discussing
animal preservation).-signal contrast,
addition, and other
logical relationships
(e.g., however,
although,
nevertheless,
similarly, moreover, in
addition).

DD8302299BC34531A583916B26021F35.description:
Acquire and use
accurately level-appropriate

conversational, general
academic, technology,
and domain-specific
words and phrases,
including those that
signal spatial and
temporal relationships
(e.g., After dinner that
night we went looking
for them).

D3CFA72DD6E7447CA304359A29F3FC5C.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Use words and
phrases acquired
through conversations,
reading and being
read to, and
responding to texts,
including using
adjectives and
adverbs to describe
(e.g., When other
people are happy that
makes me happy

4DE16B19319B4D618CB14B8F7B1D358A.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Use words and
phrases acquired
through conversations,
reading and being
read to, and
responding to texts,
including using
frequently occurring
conjunctions to signal
simple relationships
(e.g., because).

E71E3542E2AF4E5EABF849BC3B7867FA.description:
Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words
and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career
readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering
a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

A41E328F2A3A4A5894F791AC8F634A89.description:
Use the relationship
between particular
words (e.g., synonyms,
antonyms, homographs)
to better understand
each of the words.

603D0599174F477E9382FBC88B174D69.description:
Recognize and
explain the meaning of
common idioms,
adages, and proverbs.

EEC07B00D5CF4A03A16217BDF307E8E3.description:
Interpret figurative
language, including
similes and metaphors,
in context.

07CE3869AAD6413BB5B8AAC69119237B.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Demonstrate
understanding of
figurative language,
word relationships,
and nuances in word
meanings.

C652E88DD58A42988883F9C6189D7B25.description:
Distinguish shades of
meaning among related
words that describe
states of mind or
degrees of certainty
(e.g., knew, believed,
suspected, heard,
wondered).

E849D612ECA545E5A95C0D2273AF9C9A.description:
Identify real-life
connections between
words and their use
(e.g., describe people
who are friendly or
helpful).

1083CE12B8124FB081CF5302E47B719A.description:
Distinguish the literal
and non-literal
meanings of words and
phrases in context (e.g.,
take steps).

D4C51B0043664E40B3EDDD756D4D8FE0.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and
nuances in word
meanings.

4BA1C1207F25417D94279B8D9F0288CB.description:
Distinguish shades of
meaning among verbs
differing in manner (e.g.,
look, peek, glance,
stare, glare, scowl) and
adjectives differing in
intensity (e.g., large,
gigantic) by defining or
choosing them or by
acting out the meanings.

EBF78D21F9CB42D99C6C6A1F66D197A7.description:
Identify real-life
connections between
words and their use
(e.g., note places at
home that are cozy).

6DD03DCC34154F13BD25CB160DBE1502.description:
Define words by
category and by one or
more key attributes
(e.g., a duck is a bird
that swims; a tiger is a
large cat with stripes).

5BF93980480E4817BC2605ECAAC42487.description:
Sort words into
categories (e.g., colors,
clothing) to gain a sense
of the concepts the
categories represent.

0D684F4110484C9C807EE6342163DB63.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): With guidance and
support, demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and
nuances in word
meanings.

723A4D8BA8F442F5AE6722739109D487.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

379CFE652803420D8D3EF0A6448CE035.description:
Verify the preliminary
determination of the
meaning of a word or
phrase (e.g., by checking
the inferred meaning in
context or in a dictionary).

0E53C9E8F55D49E8AF54E3BEA8BFC189.description:
Consult reference
materials (e.g.,
dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print
and digital, to find the
pronunciation of a word or
determine or clarify its
precise meaning or its part
of speech.

B4E1E0421AD749F089A858D601B61A2F.description:
Use common, gradeappropriate
Greek or Latin
affixes and roots as clues
to the meaning of a word
(e.g., audience, auditory,
audible).

5E41350A2C0D43898EC4879AC6C64FCE.description:
Use context (e.g., the
overall meaning of a
sentence or paragraph; a
word’s position or function
in a sentence) as a clue to
the meaning of a word or
phrase.

231B56C12BA44D73A79630575A0C621F.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Determine or clarify
the meaning of unknown
and multiple-meaning
words and phrases,
choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

8547D8FAADB144EBA03C2149D9D36BF9.description:
Consult reference
materials (e.g.,
dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print
and digital, to find the
pronunciation and
determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key
words and phrases.

36145CCCDABA4A50A2E7A06BAF5E63ED.description:
Use common, gradeappropriate
Greek and
Latin affixes and roots
as clues to the meaning
of a word (e.g.,
telegraph, autograph,
photograph,
photosynthesis).

2A4963999C1A4E50A9DAE80017A0CA35.description:
Use context (e.g.,
definitions, examples,
restatements,
cause/effect
relationships and
comparisons in text) as
a clue to the meaning of
a word or phrase.

F0CFD199791F4F82B670474A371BFE13.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Determine or
clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning
words and
phrases, choosing
flexibly from a range
of strategies.

829B2852C21345DEB949F8C4CAAA7240.description:
Use glossaries and
beginning dictionaries,
both print and digital, to
determine or clarify the
meaning of words and
phrases.

B2D3EA866E2E47BA9C44450C567FAE7D.description:
Use knowledge of the
meaning of individual
words to predict the
meaning of compound
words (e.g., birdhouse,
lighthouse, housefly;
bookshelf, notebook).

D7375A63546249229DEB6DD262498886.description:
Use a known root
word as a clue to the
meaning of an unknown
word with the same root
(e.g., addition,
additional).

E0E1771ECF5B4E7D9F0E3CF11987B96C.description:
Determine the
meaning of the new
word formed when a
known prefix is added to
a known word (e.g.,
happy/unhappy,
tell/retell).

A4F658A38FF8413CBCC6A70A37FB24C9.description:
Use sentence-level
context as a clue to the
meaning of a word or
phrase.

65CFAC0411EA4BEBBF3426285DD7FBBB.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Determine or
clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiplemeaning
words and
phrases, choosing
flexibly from an array
of strategies

C0A979920CA74B07850201BD50569960.description:
Identify frequently
occurring root words
(e.g., look) and their
inflectional forms (e.g.,
looks, looked, looking).

A741398F4AD44CD696DECD5B8B87B8FE.description:
Use frequently
occurring affixes as a
clue to the meaning of a
word.

400C9825ECD74C1DA846E25B26ACEFA9.description:
Use sentence-level
context as a clue to the
meaning of a word or
phrase.

D41DEA6FA32542898D9242D970D97791.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Determine or
clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning
words and
phrases, choosing
flexibly from an array
of strategies.

F0CC1E69A3884B6F9B347479DC2B3CC3.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and
phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and
specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

9E676906472E435DB388D0D0B701F3C4.description:
Choose language that
expresses ideas precisely
and concisely, recognizing
and eliminating wordiness
and redundancy.

149EAE717F39487C8862DDD202C78B6F.description:
Maintain consistency in
style and tone.

0B7E78145D81494B91284683047368EC.description:
Vary sentence patterns
for meaning,
reader/listener interest,
and style.

F7664757EDE34E44B1036BD13CBC79EC.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Use knowledge of
language and its
conventions when
writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.

72F763E32D54405CB92C4CA2C54EB7DC.description:
Compare and
contrast the varieties of
English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in
stories, dramas, or
poems.

6AA913CA00B3453FB2768BC2858346FD.description:
Expand, combine,
and reduce sentences
for meaning,
reader/listener interest,
and style.

C779DEDDFFD94FA6B7033C4B31C3C85A.description:
Differentiate between
contexts that call for
formal English (e.g.,
presenting ideas) and
situations where
informal discourse is
appropriate (e.g., small-group
discussion).

C7DB152E530A44ECBA726D2FB3FACAC6.description:
Choose words and
phrases to convey ideas
precisely.

4DF893E4AE2D4A4CAA9ABFEE36E4F11D.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Use knowledge of
language and its
conventions when
writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.

F9A9ACE9DB1F4D90AE8D74F97B118D86.description:
Recognize and
observe differences
between the
conventions of spoken
and written standard
English.

FE2E035376034B3F8217232F000CECF8.description:
Choose words and
phrases for effect.

F875CDD5FBDB47A6A3D0D19D31BDAA06.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Use knowledge of
language and its
conventions when
writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.

49236D6919A44D969160A66DED31397B.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different
contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when
reading or listening.

25B85DFE3226427F8E6E58573A025F28.description:
Use an ellipsis to
indicate an omission.

E757522F9ACE4C47A8DFC714AC594EC4.description:
Use a comma to
separate coordinate
adjectives (e.g., It was a
fascinating, enjoyable
movie but not He wore an
old[,] green shirt).

9393C4D70D4E4496ACF12006CFAD0DC6.description:
Use punctuation
(commas, parentheses,
ellipsis, dashes) to set off
nonrestrictive/parenthetical
elements.

666435F1D5A94D27BE749F23A899789D.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of standard
English capitalization,
punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

EB10BE14B0324F26A5DDE5688C381413.description:
Spell gradeappropriate
words
correctly, consulting
references as needed.

4A7E3B7F9BAB4190A0833B016CA32363.description:
Use a comma before
a coordinating
conjunction in a
compound sentence.

8C4418E4707C4B518533047E00A7C793.description:
Use underlining,
quotation marks, or
italics to indicate titles of
works.

5631B2C30FFC4CE19F72FB7E8C754145.description:
Use a comma to set
off the words yes and
no (e.g., Yes, thank
you), to set off a tag
question from the rest of
the sentence (e.g., It’s
true, isn’t it?), and to
indicate direct address
(e.g., Is that you,
Steve?).

D55459A23321451A8815988033395C99.description:
Use a comma to
separate an introductory
element from the rest of
the sentence.

EF87A78C242C4418A3CA6E89466A5E11.description:
Use punctuation to
separate items in a
series.

92DFF3855B1C4825A594DBF5B409108A.description:
Use commas and
quotation marks to mark
direct speech and
quotations from a text.

C8A99B450B4D4585B3BC21074650DB35.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of
standard English
capitalization,
punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

559F2462AF3B4BF3A1322A8E1B423A6F.description:
Consult reference
materials, including
beginning dictionaries,
as needed to check and
correct spellings.

2214C745542C4CB29AB314C4822C0AF4.description:
Use spelling
patterns and
generalizations (e.g.,
word families,
position-based
spellings, syllable
patterns, ending rules,
meaningful word
parts) in writing words.

9FCF1EBBC14A42DCA2F64432F8FB3CE8.description:
Generalize learned
spelling patterns when
writing words (e.g., cage→ badge; boy → boil).

6FBB5658742C44DB9492764A9AF3000F.description:
Use conventional
spelling for high frequency
and other
studied words and for
adding suffixes to base
words (e.g., sitting,
smiled, cries,
happiness).

ADB575AA13564748B54997B189933746.description:
Use an apostrophe to
form contractions and
frequently occurring
possessives.

60513C11F59D484689B1183E4F409247.description:
Use commas and
quotation marks in
dialogue.

AC0898848A1147E28ED109B935C243C1.description:
Use commas in
greetings and closings
of letters.

486F963349DA4734A74C7BB78387247C.description:
Capitalize holidays,
product names, and
geographic names.

359D171BEDD5485CB0D7CE19AA2D5EDA.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Spell untaught words
phonetically, drawing on
phonemic awareness
and spelling
conventions.

2DBDBD7110E94E34A5C8B82AF1D6739A.description:
Spell untaught words
phonetically, drawing on
phonemic awareness
and spelling
conventions.

F009B7307DD64C01B213CB1FB9B2F4F2.description:
Use conventional
spelling for words with
common spelling
patterns and for
frequently occurring
irregular words.

CC5AC1DD2854422B867534383EE84965.description:
Spell simple words
phonetically, drawing on
knowledge of soundletter
relationships.

91184C16932742ABA5A00B8C6211E551.description:
Write a letter or letters
for most consonant and
short-vowel sounds
(phonemes).

2DA4231DE68D40D5B48118D5662F0201.description:
Use commas in dates
and to separate single
words in a series.

9F5F3B9F5E104955BB6842BF358D8CC0.description:
Capitalize dates and
names of people.

01FCF42D6A8E4AC5A90D7DD2E8B772B2.description:
Capitalize the first
word in a sentence and
the pronoun I.

D09C85DAF645408FBEE896062D44125F.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of
standard English
capitalization,
punctuation, and
spelling when writing.

B7F9B03EF77643CC825407F1F6E8465A.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

F4EBD525977C44F9AD59F1B3B013092C.description:
Place phrases and
clauses within a sentence,
recognizing and correcting
misplaced and dangling
modifiers.

F2D9C720DBE74E2FB600C74E0F230974.description:
Choose among simple,
compound, complex, and
compound-complex
sentences to signal differing
relationships among ideas.

FAB98F37689D41CEB144C1F07E3092F1.description:
Explain the function of
phrases and clauses in
general and their function in
specific sentences.

3F82B65B70E8492F9CB69E0B28B91C81.description:
Recognize and correct
inappropriate shifts in verb
voice and mood.

D325A39E6A104C348D03BF2F00172C2F.description:
Form and use verbs in
the indicative, imperative,
interrogative, conditional,
and subjunctive mood.

68B5EFFB877743BD91C713B2F98BD201.description:
Form and use verbs in
the active and passive
voice.

65DB8F7848024F71A567AFDE63B7B871.description:
Explain the function of
verbals (gerunds,
participles, infinitives) in
general and their function in
particular sentences.

6CC81B7A217F4A5BBCE630A9F5D0013B.description:
Recognize variations
from standard English in
their own and others’ writing
and speaking, and identify
and use strategies to
improve expression in
conventional language.

CCAD6156EFD04D7882E09F332AF10D8F.description:
Recognize and correct
vague or unclear
pronouns.

951D56491A2F438F8567064A2732005C.description:
Recognize and correct
inappropriate shifts in
pronoun number and
person.

F1FC1DC1E0DC4CCAB274573C41BD4C08.description:
Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case
(subjective, objective, and
possessive).

FE8E85937D304084944C948ED3E138AF.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of standard
English grammar and
usage when writing or
speaking.

9AEBBE36B2204AABA9B853293FE79053.description:
Produce complete
sentences, recognizing
and correcting
inappropriate fragments
and run-ons.

D6A0DC8B75664430A30846396630CCA2.description:
Order adjectives
within sentences
according to
conventional patterns
(e.g., a small red bag
rather than a red small
bag).

C9BA2328B7514F4CBCDBB57B67892DB9.description:
Recognize and
correct inappropriate
shifts in verb tense.

6140EBFC7E4F476E9B8A215F9B98D116.description:
Use verb tense to
convey various times,
sequences, states, and
conditions.

0EB07F0C275A4840937A86CE86298BDE.description:
Form and use the
perfect (e.g., I had
walked; I have walked; I
will have walked) verb
tenses.

344B31399E1E4B14BE4387FA554FA9C8.description:
Use modal auxiliaries
(e.g., can, may, must) to
convey various
conditions.

EF56E877350E4F46A17C2142D0069E6B.description:
Form and use the
progressive (e.g., I was
walking; I am walking;
I will be walking) verb
tenses.

6201193CEE424DBC9532E62E8D1D8B0C.description:
Use relative pronouns
(who, whose, whom,
which, that) and relative
adverbs (where, when,
why).

F3B738B814F04392ADAB52763BAD4FE7.description:
Explain the function
of conjunctions,
prepositions, and
interjections in general
and their function in
particular sentences.

BA686F2E11814887A9462BDFE61AF4A6.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of
standard English
grammar and usage
when writing or
speaking.

F388B46529724E4BA53661292400135B.description:
Produce, expand,
and rearrange complete
simple and compound
sentences (e.g., The
boy watched the movie;
The little boy watched
the movie; The action movie was watched by
the little boy).

78C86C66455D497F8F4003EA83460AFC.description:
Produce simple,
compound, and
complex sentences.

1A99ECF7C1D44C819372EDE813576BCC.description:
Form and use
comparative and
superlative adjectives
and adverbs, and
choose between them
depending on what is to
be modified.

3D76BD66D8824127BDA4789E7981B3C6.description:
Ensure subject-verb
and pronoun antecedent
agreement.

D96D63A1D847472F8DDD533039386B69.description:
Form and use the
simple (e.g., I walked; I
walk; I will walk) verb
tenses.

D78B65FC631F481EB0350957CFC4D15C.description:
Form and use regular
and irregular verbs.

0BC61A552E124E09BBC98E85C1121BE2.description:
Form and use the
past tense of frequently
occurring irregular verbs
(e.g., sat, hid, told).

ACD02FAC00E64FBA8D81C43F15016E9E.description:
Form and use regular
and irregular plural
nouns.

2489DB833E784CC8ADBD8A0C0ED330B1.description:
Explain the function
of nouns, pronouns,
verbs, adjectives, and
adverbs in general and
their functions in
particular sentences.

2EBD85C3F11B45DF8F899132D2003075.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of
standard English
grammar and usage
when writing or
speaking.

BA606C375CEA44EE8C67AE18EC491AA2.description:
Produce and expand
complete simple and
compound declarative,
interrogative,
imperative, and

39AA196439E443228ADD09C38044925A.description:
Understand and use
question words
(interrogatives) (e.g.,
who, what, where,
when, why, how).

6EEEDEBE9D00468F9EC2939B3CCCD632.description:
Use frequently
occurring prepositions
(e.g., during, beyond,
toward).

84BDD4F7B0AD42AC8538645F9BBD01C1.description:
Use frequently
occurring conjunctions
(e.g., and, but, or, so,
because).

66A97A90AD1C4A2A8A1139D0DE77E83D.description:
Use frequently
occurring nouns and
verbs.

C46260C433AB422A933BAE091EE23186.description:
Use verbs to convey
a sense of past,
present, and future
(e.g., Yesterday I
walked home; Today I
walk home; Tomorrow I
will walk home).

BEED2AC05C0C47A0A7B779E52B52AA2F.description:
Use personal,
possessive, and
indefinite pronouns
(e.g., I, me, my; they,
them, their; anyone,
everything).

2BB17F471F424908BDF680F1099719F6.description:
Use singular and
plural nouns with
matching verbs in basic
sentences (e.g., He
hops; We hop)

BDBFFB0B11E1457BA97CB57FAA0B87BA.description:
Use common, proper,
and possessive nouns.

4D4AE315399C4DBFA13405DAFD43E65D.description:
Print all upper- and
lowercase letters.

332AE8CF709242FB97C56FA108E19A67.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Demonstrate
command of the
conventions of
standard English
grammar and usage
when writing or
speaking.

E2FCE8C60597490C855268147D7EEFF5.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.

7E2C08538B274B089F77E286C04BE6AF.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Adapt speech to a
variety of contexts and
tasks, demonstrating
command of formal
English when indicated
or appropriate.

242FB39BCC9D4C60B72C180EEBFCB318.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Differentiate
between contexts that
call for formal English
(e.g., presenting
ideas) and situations
where informal
discourse is
appropriate (e.g.,
small-group
discussion); use
formal English when
appropriate to task
and situation.

7C86D09ED26D47999D40B2CCD1AA52CB.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Speak in complete
sentences when
appropriate to task and
situation in order to
provide requested detail
or clarification.

E3696B53F69B4F60A31EEC729FF4D787.description:
Produce complete
sentences when
appropriate to task and
situation.

0ED80E611B424B52B85FBA391EB8789B.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Speak audibly and
express thoughts,
feelings, and ideas
clearly.

6CE5A73C294B42D8A881F43C12EBCAA9.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating
command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (Note: See Language Standards 1 and 3)

F5AF84266C9A4047962823E2647FF0FC.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Integrate
multimedia and visual
displays into
presentations to clarify
information, strengthen
claims and evidence,
and add interest.

0BEAAF24A0544437B1FF1AF56F84FA50.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Include multimedia
components (e.g.,
graphics, sound) and
visual displays in
presentations when
appropriate to
enhance the
development of main
ideas or themes.

45D9423B64714DADBD26A94BB253A9DE.description:
Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express
information and enhance understanding of presentations.

54EA9F9A15F947C790BF35BEE8D2070E.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Present claims and
findings, emphasizing
salient points in a
focused, coherent
manner with relevant
evidence, sound valid
reasoning, and wellchosen
details; use
appropriate eye
contact, adequate
volume, and clear
pronunciation.

0C9E84F188FA48B99411D7B3A1878783.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Report on a topic
or text or present an
opinion, sequencing
ideas logically and
using appropriate
facts and relevant,
descriptive details to
support main ideas or
themes; speak clearly
at an understandable
pace.

9D1A95DAD1AC4D909EDFC53A69DCFEFA.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Report on a topic or
text, tell a story, or
recount an experience
with appropriate facts
and relevant,
descriptive details,
speaking clearly at an
understandable pace.

E8E3CE92E49A4AACBFBE83D5269DCEBE.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Describe people,
places, things, and
events with relevant
details, expressing
ideas and feelings
clearly.

5B59EF6101844CABADF9585C92C6ECD2.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can
follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task,
purpose, and audience.

A0FB23B06EFA4ECAB6D30A56FA1EBB13.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Delineate a
speaker’s argument
and specific claims,
evaluating the
soundness of the
reasoning and
relevance and
sufficiency of the
evidence and
identifying when
irrelevant evidence is
introduced.

68983179519644BDA67E360CD2F7BA8F.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Summarize the
points a speaker
makes and explain
how each claim is
supported by reasons
and evidence.

1EEE4973481F4D4CA3C0FECC651D6ECF.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Ask and answer
questions about
information from a
speaker, offering
appropriate elaboration
and detail.

180F3A0D581B4D86B1707AF7F35DDA25.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Ask and answer
questions in order to
seek help, get
information, or clarify
something that is not
understood.

8023B35060B240D382680390249D25FC.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

D70E50F9C20848DFBEDF97A3D3AE8EC6.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Analyze the
purpose of information presented in diverse
media and formats
(e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally)
and evaluate the
motives (e.g., social,
commercial, political)
behind its presentation.

781701A1B83C4D5EB1DA9581DBB70B42.description:
Summarize a written
text read aloud or
information presented in
diverse media and
formats, including
visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

A42CEE6D99A34A70A83E3AF0549759A4.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Paraphrase
portions of a text read aloud or information
presented in diverse
media and formats,
including visually,
quantitatively, and
orally.

4F165A4E2B45400B91230C67373245A6.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Determine the main
ideas and supporting details of a text read
aloud or information
presented in diverse
media and formats,
including visually,
quantitatively, and
orally.

EBABFECDC2C74C7C849DC7049C577302.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Confirm
understanding of a text read aloud or
information presented
orally or through
other media by asking
and answering
questions about key
details and requesting
clarification if
something is not
understood.

AADD0B2F3813452AB8A54D5793307E7B.description:
Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats,
including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

A4D687DF68F44A18B6FEFF85A1C08C84.description:
Acknowledge new
information expressed by
others, and, when
warranted, qualify or
justify their own views in
light of the evidence
presented.

8C3BDFF3A3EA438C87ADBDA0D45A0019.description:
Pose questions that
connect the ideas of
several speakers and
respond to others’
questions and comments
with relevant evidence,
observations, and ideas.

6FE1A25C9DB24059B5023D66CB9A4537.description:
Follow rules for
collegial discussions and
decision-making, track
progress toward specific
goals and deadlines, and
define individual roles as
needed.

D5F64AE9D620486BA052BA89D09DEC30.description:
Come to discussions
prepared by having read
or researched material
under study; explicitly
draw on that preparation
by referring to evidence
on the topic, text, or
issue to probe and reflect
on ideas under
discussion.

F493DD7B7EB1421CA175556432CDB0E8.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Engage effectively
in a range of
collaborative
discussions (one-onone,
in groups, and
teacher-led) with
diverse partners,
building on others’
ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

6A456745F9DD49709B0B317E74115E2F.description:
Review the key ideas
expressed and draw
conclusions in light of
information and
knowledge gained from
the discussions.

17C6366DCBB046C398642225CC0D7C30.description:
Pose and respond to
specific questions by
making comments that
contribute to the
discussion and
elaborate on the
remarks of others.

CC42AA439DFA45F0BF026B01AE8B0FFD.description:
Follow agreed-upon
rules for discussions
and carry out assigned
roles.

70DD532F7F4246049A9F7085554C37CF.description:
Come to discussions
prepared by having read
or studied required
material; explicitly draw
on that preparation and
other information known
about the topic to
explore ideas under
discussion.

243C3EDCE55047578D29F7C1B7793262.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Engage effectively
in a range of
collaborative
discussions (one-onone,
in groups, and
teacher-led) with
diverse partners,
building on others’
ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

C15823D27E3D46148F9992434FD86BC3.description:
Explain their own ideas
and understanding in light
of the discussion.

47F284EA52E14F93B693769A89B4B02C.description:
Ask questions to check
understanding of
information presented,
stay on topic, and link
their comments to the
remarks of others.

BEFD27AD883E48418F42B13FFDFCECA8.description:
Follow agreed-upon
rules for discussions (e.g.,
gaining the floor in
respectful ways, listening
to others with care,
speaking one at a time
about the topics and texts
under discussion).

8570B817A9BE407E8A3D0FC780D6A0D0.description:
Come to discussions
prepared by having read
or studied required
material; explicitly draw
on that preparation and
other information known
about the topic to explore
ideas under discussion.

8E5FD0D24F154C74A3799708329A4604.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Engage effectively in
a range of collaborative
discussions (one-onone,
in groups, and
teacher-led) with
diverse partners,
building on others’
ideas and expressing
their own clearly.

17AD2DDC3CDF4BD2A6E4F121B20747EA.description:
Ask questions to
clear up any confusion
about the topics and
texts under discussion.

E24F01CDDC464B49B7B358FC25E6EDA8.description:
Build on others’ talk in
conversations by
responding to the
comments of others
through multiple
exchanges.

7210212E32994F46BB0B957741964A02.description:
Follow agreed-upon
rules for discussions
(e.g., listening to others
with care, speaking one
at a time about the
topics and texts under
discussion).

A3B3E822B64D4F70A08AF8253DC6DD1D.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Participate in
collaborative
conversations with
diverse partners in
small and larger
groups.

ED7399E1A49546A58CD183A31CD7011A.description:
Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and
collaborations with diverse partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and
persuasively.

699CDF3371324F23A9E9FC949FF6454E.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Note: Students
continue to draw
evidence from literary
or informational texts
to support analysis,
reflection, and
research.

92D7D7A8ACC041E6BE2292E8D2C9A67A.description:
Apply reading
standards from this level
to literary nonfiction (e.g.,
“Analyze how a text
makes connections
among and distinctions
between individuals’ ideas
or events”).

059C3AEE6D5D4495AC04363C2C150386.description:
Apply reading
standards from this level
to literature (e.g.,
“Determine a theme or
central idea of a text and
how it is conveyed
through particular details; provide a summary of the
text distinct from personal
opinions or judgments”).

1942DC7BA9AE44EC8AEC859DC138072F.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Draw evidence from
literary or informational
texts to support
analysis, reflection, and
research.

BECDA37B466F49E9A99234A6E5AAFE2F.description:
Apply reading
standards from this level
to informational text (e.g.,
“Explain how an author
uses reasons and
evidence to support
particular points in a text,
identifying which reasons
and evidence support
which point(s)”).

D3C1BBC31E5D4079971D2E7DD5DBF077.description:
Apply reading
standards from this level
to literature (e.g., “Refer
to details and examples
in a text when explaining
what the text says
explicitly and when drawing inferences from
the text”).

A5472B1B5BD148A68A04BB457554C97E.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard 10.)

6EEBAD89B6594500BF62890E9B7502FB.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. (Apply this standard to texts of appropriate complexity as outlined by Standard 10.)

199B3C9C3D014CE68DA7B0CB52A8C543.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Gather relevant
information from
multiple print and
digital sources, using
search terms
effectively; assess the
credibility and
accuracy of each
source; and quote or
paraphrase the data
and conclusions of
others while avoiding
plagiarism and
following a standard
format for citation.

6F7D07681AE0474D894057652C922513.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Recall relevant
information from
experiences or gather
relevant information
from print and digital
sources; summarize or
paraphrase information
in notes and finished
work, and provide a list
of sources.

E1F3D9B1E4C24AD49A9C87769E6A8BCF.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Recall information
from experiences or
gather information
from print and digital
sources; take brief
notes on sources and
sort evidence into
provided categories.

581BE4F0B1904D899DF4D9BD57D4D10B.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): With guidance
and support, recall
information from
experiences or
gather information
from provided
sources to answer a
question.

9D25D03A3F6347ACBFDB31D07CAA362F.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the
credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

AC5CB008EEFB44DEA0D2389788AAF0AF.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Conduct short
research projects to
answer a question,
drawing on several
sources and generating
additional related,
focused questions for
further research and
investigation.

723702DF17A5463A87FDE3985461F62A.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Conduct short
research projects that
use several sources to
build knowledge
through investigation of
different aspects of a
topic.

27D901D483654E859335AE7BA6C5614E.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Conduct short
research projects that
build knowledge about
a topic.

347C037C013D4D98BB5549BC59F3B5D3.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Participate in
shared research and
writing projects
(e.g., explore a
number of “how-to”
books on a given
topic and use them
to write a sequence
of instructions).

63D9C5F713C34222AEAB81935C7D2FD0.description:
Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused
questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

542E333606CF4ED49EB4A2FFA195717C.description:
Locate, organize,
analyze, evaluate,
synthesize, and ethically
use electronic
information from a variety
of sources and media.

CFE7C4867D1D4EBB8765C379EFB9A92C.description:
Create original works
using a variety of
programs such as Word
and Excel.

D27FF42737114F45B33E6E39239775D3.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Use technology,
including the Internet,
to produce and publish
writing and link to and
cite sources as well as
to interact and
collaborate with others,
including linking to and
citing sources.

3DA3F3A7B97B4BDDB773D9088D27F8AC.description:
Evaluate and select
information sources and
digital tools based on the
appropriateness to
specific tasks.

1C03609C10354EF2BCF168C6A751820D.description:
Insert a table or graph
using drag and drop.

0CE587255763462989B0968942582C97.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): With some guidance
and support, use
technology, including
the Internet, to produce
and publish writing as
well as to interact and
collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient
command of
keyboarding skills to
type a minimum of one
page in a single sitting.

9587B821373B43A1891238A5CFAB0CAC.description:
Discuss how
technology is used for
communication, critical
thinking, research, and
innovation.

511F4081AACC48F5A56D60E2E14E1306.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): With guidance and
support, use
technology to produce
and publish writing
(using keyboarding
skills) as well as to
interact and collaborate
with others.

969BF37CC22D41DAA5CB6D04DF652074.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): With guidance
and support, use a
variety of digital
tools to produce and
publish writing,
including in
collaboration with
peers.

EBB28EF904A24A9CBC1809EF41C4B6C3.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing, and to
interact and collaborate with others.

2D86B2FE834549F7A66077E2B41B541B.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): With some
guidance and support
from peers and others,
develop and strengthen
writing as needed by
planning, revising,
editing, rewriting, or
trying a new approach,
focusing on how well
purpose and audience
have been addressed.
(Editing for
conventions should
demonstrate command
of Language standards
1–3 at this level.)

D100D761E85F46F8835F8CAFEC731170.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): With guidance and
support from peers and
others, develop and
strengthen writing as
needed by planning,
revising, editing,
rewriting, or trying a
new approach. (Editing
for conventions should
demonstrate command
of Language standards
1–3 at this level.)

23556652C80746BEB45CFC4CCDA017BE.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): With guidance and
support from peers and
others, develop and
strengthen writing as
needed by planning,
revising, and editing.
(Editing for
conventions should
demonstrate command
of Language standards
1–3 at this level.)

EABEC8377E5743F295D39CC75F044ABE.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): With guidance
and support focus
on a topic, respond
to questions and
suggestions from
peers, and add
details to strengthen
writing as needed.

600F140B6E3D4656863526159EF44DCB.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing,
rewriting, or trying a new approach.

49A12988D46F494898E5E2617B109C6C.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Produce clear and
coherent writing in
which the
development,
organization, and style
are appropriate to task,
purpose, and audience.

0ADF9C9B300D444389ECA038184104C6.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Produce clear and
coherent writing in
which the development
and organization are
appropriate to task,
purpose, and audience.

5522566A3E9D4921818D78F95BACA024.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Produce writing in
which the development
and organization are
appropriate to task and
purpose.

BD23954737364FC29E58E5DBDFF37FFA.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

32CDC79B832D4F7B963BEE87C05280B3.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Note: Students’
narrative skills
continue to grow in
these levels as
students work to
incorporate narrative
elements effectively
into their arguments
and
informative/explanatory
texts.

C54F0C22338A4B7096D577C72A510B42.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Note: Students’
narrative skills continue
to grow in these levels
as students work to
incorporate narrative
elements effectively into
their arguments and
informative/explanatory
texts.

A81180798B5D4AC5BB769384454D5201.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Write narratives in
which they recount a
well-elaborated event
or short sequence of
events, include details
to describe actions,
thoughts, and feelings,
use temporal words to
signal event order, and
provide a sense of
closure.

2950612D18EB46B69A2C89478288CDF9.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Write narratives
in which they
recount two or more
appropriately
sequenced events,
include some details
regarding what
happened, use
temporal words to
signal event order,
and provide some
sense of closure.

F2D1767BD7C945578C5DC68B9FC92B32.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event sequences.

99C8BF48FAA04AD9B150141C386C2DA3.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section that
follows from and
supports the information
or explanation
presented.

4E9F01A9522441E5A442245D3ABEDD10.description:
Establish and maintain
a formal style.

794D9910405A4CEA8FD4700616BBCEBC.description:
Use precise language
and domain-specific vocabulary to inform
about or explain the
topic.

D10A7278703545E6BA8D982094DE3245.description:
Use appropriate
transitions to create
cohesion and clarify the
relationships among
ideas and concepts.

3791BD25CB584A5C857A60AFBC0BE970.description:
Develop the topic with
relevant facts, definitions,
concrete details,
quotations, or other
information and
examples.

83CAF96C75B547B5B59ABE5A4657DDDA.description:
Introduce a topic
clearly, previewing what
is to follow; organize
ideas, concepts, and
information, using
strategies such as
definition, classification,
comparison/contrast, and
cause/ effect; include
formatting (e.g.,
headings), graphics (e.g.,
charts, tables), and
multimedia when useful
to aiding comprehension.

62A22DF8B2484E71A6EA3D8805C6DC35.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Write informative
and explanatory texts
to examine a topic and
convey ideas,
concepts, and
information through
the selection,
organization, and
analysis of relevant
content. (This includes
the narration of
historical events,
scientific procedures/
experiments, or
technical processes.)

D209BB4848A94EF186CB25D6D2E0D18D.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section
related to the information
or explanation presented.

9F478C82C8174E4691C87D7C731BAEB6.description:
Use precise language
and domain-specific
vocabulary to inform
about or explain the topic.

F5977029F71F4DECB55ACF4EC225787C.description:
Link ideas within
categories of information
using words and phrases
(e.g., another, for
example, also, because).

31AD9FE82D924B9AAAED9CFCBD921C50.description:
Develop the topic with
facts, definitions, concrete
details, quotations, or
other information and
examples related to the
topic.

AB1EC11425A4412BB99F83368F3591B4.description:
Introduce a topic
clearly and group related
information in paragraphs
and sections; include
formatting (e.g.,
headings), illustrations,
and multimedia when
useful to aiding
comprehension.

6C78434913F94C84A77801420A9E2541.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Write informative
and explanatory texts to
examine a topic and
convey ideas and
information clearly.

26BC2D6FF44047D9933C75E1DA27A8F2.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section.

BDCEB75ED3AF45E6A113DB54225AB903.description:
Use linking words and
phrases (e.g., also,
another, and, more, but)
to connect ideas within
categories of information.

E2E396DA64CF4F828B1C5A62D7323852.description:
Develop the topic with
facts, definitions, and
details.

500693DF974E49398BE6AA255D3CBCE7.description:
Introduce a topic and
group related information
together; include
illustrations when useful
to aiding comprehension.

44DAE9031BEE45D3BCCE8BEC522E52E8.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Write informative
and explanatory texts
to examine a topic and
convey ideas and
information clearly.

A75003790BE04A81B09C704D7C008A31.description:
NRS Level 1 (0.0-1.9): Write informative
and explanatory
texts in which they
name a topic, supply
some facts about
the topic, and
provide some sense
of closure.

447A20A502044E7494C56609B2F6D6C9.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and
information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of
content.

F06DD2BA1D684CF9A4B1A57C730776AB.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section that
follows from and
supports the argument
presented.

23AC9F06794A4C858B6E914E6C500009.description:
Establish and maintain
a formal style.

9A491EC87F4842CABBA069FD5AF94730.description:
Use words, phrases,
and clauses to create
cohesion and clarify the
relationships among
claim(s), reasons, and
evidence.

3B11587EAEDC4A56BE357BF7984F4548.description:
Support claim(s) with
logical reasoning and
relevant evidence, using
accurate, credible
sources and
demonstrating an
understanding of the
topic or text.

0AA4F925166441018400BEDF39B0BD3B.description:
Introduce claim(s),
acknowledge alternate or
opposing claims, and
organize the reasons and
evidence logically.

84F30DAC31624DD487D234C3B5190EF5.description:
NRS Level 4 (6.0-8.9): Write arguments to
support claims with
clear reasons and
relevant evidence.

B981D07726544E8B9C025B42FAEAD0F6.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section
related to the opinion
presented.

BB9C998FB3BD4A0296FEA505F612015C.description:
Link opinion and
reasons using words,
phrases, and clauses
(e.g., consequently,
specifically).

0418D329831A432CA1F4905064441C6F.description:
Provide logically
ordered reasons that are
supported by facts and
details.

FF090222C48F4ED1B13DFDF9F0C39735.description:
Introduce a topic or text
clearly, state an opinion,
and create an
organizational structure in
which ideas are logically
grouped to support the
writer’s purpose.

3E26E360E3304A1A82EB8237B3AD6B16.description:
NRS Level 3 (4.0-5.9): Write opinion
pieces on topics or
texts, supporting a point
of view with reasons
and information.

F55D009B4F2C43049CA995006C290CAC.description:
Provide a concluding
statement or section.

73946094A7E74CE3850A19C1777BC63B.description:
Use linking words and
phrases (e.g., because,
therefore, since, for
example) to connect
opinion and reasons.

275F6F56832D4FB188D33A683118C45A.description:
Provide reasons that
support the opinion.

F4376D0BB03F4338A93747A0E3C2719E.description:
Introduce the topic or
text they are writing
about, state an opinion,
and create an
organizational structure
that lists reasons.

1A5CA5F7C7674910A66085BEB460035F.description:
NRS Level 2 (2.0-3.9): Write opinion
pieces on topics or
texts, supporting a
point of view with
reasons.

4E962F38A58043E1BBA999040A163737.description:
Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts,
using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
